p.s: His line of arguments is very clear.
In the fist third of the speech, he talkestalks about the consequences of the Brexit and uses the Argumentsarguments that were named before.
Then in the second third he speaks about the for his opinion best relationship between the UK and the EU they could have after the Brexit.
His arguments were also already named before in the text.
In the last third of his speech, he tells the listener about the good equivalence system the EU has.
He says that it's the best legal system in the world for financial services (l. 24-25) and that the EU will not change who they are if the UK leaves (l. 27-28).
The last point that he mentions is the benefits the US companies get from the open market of the EU (l. 30-31).
With this special devidingdividing in his speech he is following an intention.
At first he tells the listener about the bad things that happen after the Brexit and what for a big impact this has on the whole infrastructure.
Then he gives a solution for both sides, the UK and the EU.
He names the benefits of a good financial relationship and a joining from the UK to the Single Market of the EU.
In the last past he then tries to convince the listener again with some strong arguments for the EU market and also gives examples for the success of it.
His language is not very complicated but also not very simple.
He uses a few words that are hard but all in all everybody that hears this speech can understand what he means.
This is very important because he wants to convince normal people and the politicians from his opinion.
It is still very formal because he is at the European American Chamber of Commerce.
Next I am going to analyse the stylistic devices he uses in the speech.
Right in the first line he uses an enumeration.
He says that he regrets the decision of the UK, as a politicanpolitician and a citizen.
He wants to make it clear that he thinks it's bad from both of his views.
This helps to stress his message.
The next device is aan anaphora in line 5 and 7.
He uses the word this at both sentences at the beginning.
This creates a dramatic effect and also emphaticeempathy.
In this part from line 4 to 5 he also uses two ennumerationsenumerations, wichwhich help to point out his arguments and let them appear stronger.
The next ennumerationenumeration are in the lines 11-13, 16 and 22-23.
These have the same effect and the same task as the others before.
In lines 25-26 you can find two rhetorical questions.
These should underline his argument and get the reader to think about this.
In the following he uses a few ennumerationsenumerations but also repetitions.
This has the effect that the reader remembers the arguments and is still going to think about it after the speech.
Throughout the whole speech he uses different personal pronouns.
When he uses I, he wants to show the reader that this topic is personal and these ideas are from him.
Everytime he uses we he wants to make the reader feel included, so his arguments work better.
To sum it up you can say that the speech was very informative and the speaker used his arguments and stylistic devices very well to convince someone from his opinion.
